Expectation1: Attending children's school events and activities
Situation1: An open class is scheduled at the school, and the parent should attend
Situation2: This is the last weekend before the partner relocates abroad for months.
Story: I stared at the calendar, my heart pounding. Saturday was circled in red—my daughter’s open class at school. She’d been practicing her lines for weeks, her eyes shining every time she asked, “Will you be there, Dad?” I promised I wouldn’t miss it. But then, my phone buzzed. A message from Mia: “Can’t believe it’s our last weekend together before I leave. Let’s make it special?” She’d been so patient with my busy schedule, and now, with her move abroad looming, she deserved my undivided attention. I felt torn in two. My daughter needed me in the audience, cheering her on, making her feel important. Mia needed me to show her she mattered, that our relationship was worth holding onto across the distance. Both deserved all of me, but I only had one Saturday. The weight of their expectations pressed on my chest, and I wondered how I could possibly choose without letting someone down.
